summary: This is an internal FBI email from October 1, 2019, coordinating meetings with the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and Eastern District of New York (EDNY) on October 15, 2019. The email outlines the agenda to educate the districts on using a CAFI (Child Abuse Forensic Interviewer) in investigations, preventing another 'Epstein scenario' regarding AUSA roles in interviews, and coordinating a separate meeting with Epstein victims in Florida.

persons.name: Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.role: FBI Assistant Special Agent in Charge
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating meetings with SDNY and EDNY and ensuring coverage for meetings in New York and Florida.

events.title: Meetings with SDNY and EDNY
events.description: Scheduled meetings with the Southern District of New York at 10:30 and the Eastern District of New York at 3:30 to discuss the role of CAFIs, preventing another Epstein scenario, and expert testimony in human trafficking matters.

events.title: Meeting with Epstein victims in Florida
events.description: A separate meeting is being coordinated with a team to meet with Epstein victims in Florida on the same date as the New York district meetings.

keyFacts: The FBI was coordinating meetings with SDNY and EDNY on October 15, 2019, to discuss using Child Abuse Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs) in investigations.
A key objective was to prevent 'another Epstein scenario' by clarifying the role of AUSAs in interviews.
A separate meeting with Epstein victims in Florida was being coordinated for the same date.
The email indicates ongoing FBI investigations and inter-agency coordination following Jeffrey Epstein's case.
The document references the need for expert testimony to help juries understand victimization in human trafficking matters.
